captions.text:
To do whatever
you tell me,
drill sergeant!

God damn it, gump,
you're a goddamn genius.

That's the most
outstanding answer
I've ever heard.

You must have
a goddamn I.Q. Of 160.

You are goddamn gifted,
private gump.

<i>Now for some reason,</i>
<i>I fit in the army</i>

What you do
is drag your nets
along the bottom.

You can catch over
a hundred pounds
of shrimp.

Less what you
spends on gas--

Why did you put
that weapon together
so quickly?

You told me to,
drill sergeant.

This is a new
company record.

You're going to be
a general someday!

Now disassemble
your weapon
and continue!

Shrimp is the fruit
of the sea.

You can barbecue it,
boil it, broil it,

They's, uh, shrimp kabobs,
shrimp creole,

Shrimp gumbo,
pan fried, deep fried,

title: Bubba on Shrimp - Forrest Gump (3/9) Movie CLIP (1994) HD

comments.text:
Great attention should be given to a tea gathering, 
which we can speak of as 
"one time, one meeting" (一期一会, ichigo, ichie). 
Even though the host and guests may see each other often socially, 
one day's gathering can never be repeated exactly. 
Viewed this way, the meeting is indeed a once-in-a-lifetime occasion. 
The host, 
accordingly, must in true sincerity take the greatest care with every 
aspect of the gathering 
and devote himself entirely to ensuring that nothing is rough. 
The guests, for their part, must understand that the gathering cannot occur 
again and, appreciating how the host has flawlessly planned it, 
must also participate with true sincerity. 
This is what is meant by "one time, one meeting."...﻿
